intro: Eupatorium voglii, commonly known as the Italian thoroughwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Eupatorium voglii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
